intro: Cymboseris palaestina, commonly known as the Palestine cymboseris, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Cymboseris palaestina is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
